:::{.question type=multiple_choice points=1}
Which statement is true about abstract classes in Java?

- [ ] An abstract class can be instantiated directly.
- [x] An abstract class can have both abstract and non-abstract methods.
- [ ] All methods in an abstract class must be abstract.
- [ ] An abstract class cannot have a constructor.
:::

:::{.question type=multiple_answers points=2}
Which of the following collections in Java do not allow duplicate elements? (Select all that apply)

- [x] Set
- [ ] List
- [x] HashSet
- [ ] ArrayList
:::

:::{.question type=true_false points=1}
In Java, a class can inherit from multiple parent classes (multiple inheritance).

- [ ] True
- [x] False
:::

:::{.question type=short_answer points=1}
What keyword is used to manually throw an exception in Java?

- [x] throw
:::

:::{.question type=essay points=5}
Explain the concept of polymorphism in object-oriented programming. Provide a simple Java code example that demonstrates polymorphism using a superclass and at least two subclasses.
:::

:::{.question type=multiple_choice points=1}
What is the primary purpose of Generics in Java?

- [ ] To improve the performance of collection lookups.
- [ ] To allow classes to inherit from multiple interfaces.
- [x] To provide type-safety for collections and classes at compile-time.
- [ ] To automatically generate getter and setter methods.
:::

:::{.question type=short_answer points=1}
What interface must an object implement to be used as a key in a HashMap?

- [x] hashCode
- [x] equals
:::

:::{.question type=multiple_answers points=2}
What is the effect of using the `final` keyword in Java? (Select all that apply)

- [x] When applied to a variable, it makes it a constant (cannot be reassigned).
- [ ] When applied to a a method, it can still be overridden by a subclass.
- [x] When applied to a class, it prevents the class from being subclassed.
- [x] When applied to a method, it prevents it from being overridden.
:::
